I have a couple of things from Robinson.   One is a copy of his book signed=
 with a inscription 
when he gave it to Dr Compton - very cool, but not muc=
h information content, just a 
reference to happy sword collecting.   The o=
ther is a letter from Robinson (who had amazing 
penmanship) to the owner o=
f a sword that I now own describing at length who made the 
sword, where it=
 was made etc.   Let me know if this would be of any interest.   Cheers, Bo=
b.  -
-- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "excelsiorilluminati" <excelsiori=
lluminati@...> wrote:
>
> A fellow I know and his kantei group have come up=
on some correspondence 
> between Messrs. Robinson and Caldwell having to d=
o with their 
> investigation of nihonto just post war. I have been asked i=
f there are 
> other sources of original (in facsimile) material and docume=
ntation 
> that could be made available to supplement these letters. The pr=
oject 
> is in preliminary stages and any source is not too small at this p=
oint. 
> John
>
